body.name: Dockers Men's Classic Dress Belt - Regular and Big & Tall Sizing
features: Fabric type 40%PU ,44% Split Leather,16% Bond Leather
DOCKERS STYLE: This Dockers Dress Belt is the belt you need to elevate your look. The minimal design ensures versatile options for your outfits while maintaining long, durable wear.

DESIGN DETAILS: Features a light brushed silver buckle, embossed Dockers logo below the belt loop and 1.25" wide belt strap to easily fit through your pant loops. Adjusts well with 7 holes to get your perfect fit. For best care, spot clean only

CONSISTENT COMFORT: Dockers belts are made with comfort as a priority. For long workdays, social events, or just running errands - it is essential to feel comfortable in your clothing, especially in the waist area. This belt has flexibility that will keep you reaching for this belt for any occasion.

SIZING: Available in sizes 30-52. For best fit, order a belt 2" larger than your natural waist size. For example, your waist size is 36", order size Large (38-40). Small (30-32), Medium (34-36), Large (38-40), X-Large (42-44), 2X (46-48), 3X (50-52)
body.description: An essential accessory in every men's wardrobe, this Dockers men's belt will feel secure and comfortable for all-day wear. This belt features a classic elevated look while the sturdy belt strap is smooth to the touch and crafted to last. Dockers has been the authority in khaki pants for more than 30 years, so it came naturally to manufacture men's belts that compliment the Dockers collection while upholding the same standard of quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect belts. Last forever and stay in place.
reviews.reviewText: I’m buying a new one only because I have the exact same one larger, but finally lost enough weight to get a smaller one. I’ve had the old one for ten years easy and it’s fine. Also, the leather inside isn’t slick, it’s grippier so the belt buckle doesn’t keep sliding around. Will outlast 5 cheaper belts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars True to size
reviews.reviewText: Very good product. Fits true to size.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice natural leather belt
reviews.reviewText: This is a good belt. I was in need of a brown leather belt to match my watch and shoes, so this fits my clothing needs nicely. It's the right size for me, it looks good, and it seems well built enough for the moment. I do tend to put my belts to work though, and wonder how well the small clasp will hold up over time. I also feel like the holes for the clasp are a tad bit small and take extra effort to feel for. If you like this belt, are looking for a thinner and less wide belt, give this your consideration. Ultimately you should feel good about the construction and mostly decide on this based on your style needs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smaller (shorter) than expected but good value for money
reviews.reviewText: It’s 32” but please aware that it’s 32” for maximum length so if you are exact 32”, consider 34 or longer. Overall really looking good belt that goes along well with casual or former outfits and value for its money

reviews.reviewText: Feels like the material is good quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice looking on dress slacks.
reviews.reviewText: Nothing to dislike. Look good with dress slacks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Disappointing....cheaply made, bonded leather that's thin and cracks
reviews.reviewText: Summary: Bonded leather of poor quality that will deteriorate quickly.Size: Need to order 2 sizes above your pant sizeAfter looking over several different belts, I choose this one as it seemed ok and most of the reviews were positive. However, it's a poor quality belt in my opinion. After receiving this, I'm very surprised that many people say "good quality". It is definitely not. But again, that's my opinion. If you are looking for a nice leather belt, pass on this one.If you want a brown leatherish belt that can be dressy and causal, that's decently cheap, this would be fine. Depends on what you want. Maybe the positive reviews mean that, overall, belt quality has decreased over the years. I know the belts I see now are cheaper and cheaper in quality. I realize I sound like an old, crotchety man now. My wife says I'm just picky. (She didn't like the belt either though)When I want a leather belt, I want a leather belt, one that will last. I don't think that this one will. Plus, since the outer layer of leather is thin and cheap, it's just going to wrinkle/crack and eventually debond.Looks: On first glance it seems fine. Not suit wearing dressy, but most other "dressy" things would be fine. And it would be fine for casual (jeans). Buckle is a little big for my tastes, but not too big.Build: Poor. Seems good, but once you really look at it and "move it", it's pretty clear that this is your standard, cheaply built, bonded leather belt. Sigh.The leather is bonded, not a one piece setup. That should be somewhat obvious with the "padded" design. Those aren't one piece designs. But they don't have to be this bad. (My experience with bonded belts is mostly poor. One or two lasted, but most fell apart. Any dual color belt fell apart rapidly).The description on Amazon says "100% leather". The belt says "genuine leather"...but not sure what they are referring too. It's at least 3 layers, if not more, so "leather" could be any of them...but I doubt all regardless of the description.Top/Outer Layer: the visible layer of leather (thin)Middle Layer: The "stiff" layer (leather?, not sure)Bottom/Inner Layer: the layer against the pantsThe top/outer layer (that you'd see), is clearly a very thin piece of leather bonded on top of the stiff layer. When you look at the holes, it's easy to see the layer thicknesses, and the top isn't very thick. It wrinkles as you move the belt. Bad sign.The Mid Layer provides the stiffness of the belt...and it's very stiff out of the box. I'm sure it would soften, but it gives the impression that it isn't leather.The bottom/inner layer is a different leather...or differently treated (looks like fabric). Again, cheap, but nicer than the other layer.Again, first impression is that it is a stiff, thick belt. But as soon as you feel it and move it, you know it's not good leather. It is stiff, but that's due to the "mystery" middle layer. It is thick, but that's mostly due to that middle layer as well. The layer that should be thick, that you want thick to last, is the outer layer. But it's the cheapest and thinnest.The surface of top/outer layer starts wrinkling right away....something people have mentioned in other reviews (cracking/wrinkling).This is a huge sign that it is bonded, that the top layer is a thin piece of leather and that it's not going to last long (several reviews have said that much). At the very least, it is going to really wrinkle/crack in places (looking like crap). At the worst, it will crack and start to debond, then fall apart.I bent the belt around a few times, put it on and pulled it off. Leather already looking wrinkly/cracked and worn...but not in a good way. Seriously, this is a cheap belt.Size: I'm a 34/33 guy. The 36 is very small, I'm on the second hole and it's tight. Go up 2 sizes if you order.My recommendation is to look elsewhere. I'll be return this, and will be the 2nd thing I've ever returned to Amazon. But for belts, I've yet to see one on Amazon that really jumps out. There's a lot of mediocre ones in the $15-$30 range, but all basically seem the same. Good luck and I hope you find a good one.

reviews.reviewText: the leather has very visible scratches from the first time i tightened the belt. not very durable.

A little thinner than expected but I like it.
